analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya  hetu duka dassana ttika

original: Hetuṁ dassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā …. Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetum dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: In the case of a state that is a root-cause and is to be abandoned by seeing, there is: in relation to a root-cause, a state that is not a root-cause and is not to be abandoned by seeing, arising by root-cause condition … In the case of a root-cause, there are three … In the case of an indeterminate state, there are three.

original: Hetuṁ bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā …. Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nahetuṁ nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā nanahetu nanevadassanena
analyzed: hetum bhāvanāya pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  na hetum na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbam dhammam paccayā na na hetu na na iva dassanena
translated: In the case of a state that is a root-cause and is to be abandoned by development, there is: in relation to a root-cause, a state that is not a root-cause and is not to be abandoned by development, arising by root-cause condition … In the case of a root-cause, there are three … In the case of an indeterminate state, there are three.

original: nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: In the case of a state that is not a root-cause and is not to be abandoned by seeing or by development, there is: in relation to a state that is not a root-cause and is not to be abandoned by seeing or by development, a state that is not a root-cause and is not to be abandoned by seeing or by development, arising by root-cause condition. (In brief.) In the case of a root-cause, there are three … In the case of an indeterminate state, there are three.
